title.narrative: Soudan (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
Sudan (the): Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: 75% of JAR recommendations addressed in 2021 One Health Plan

target.value: TA to support the Joint Annual Review JAR 2020

comment.narrative: WHO supported FMOH to organize the Annual Review and Planning meeting replacing JAR with participation of all states MOH and key partners. The main objective was to discuss and build a consensus on health sector priorities within the concept of One Health Plan taking into consideration the challenges and bottlenecks facing the country which include the economic downturn, instability and security problems in some states in addition to fragility of health system and human resources issues. All recommendations and identified priorities were reflected and addressed in 2021 health sector annual plan

target.value: TA to support the Joint Annual Review JAR 2020

comment.narrative: WHO supported FMOH to organize the Annual Review and Planning meeting replacing JAR with participation of all states MOH and key partners. The main objective was to discuss and build a consensus on health sector priorities within the concept of One Health Plan taking into consideration the challenges and bottlenecks facing the country which include the economic downturn, instability and security problems in some states in addition to fragility of health system and human resources issues. All recommendations and identified priorities were reflected and addressed in 2021 health sector annual plan

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Management - LMC
60% of the states are implementing the accountability framework

target.value: Develop and implement accountability framework that includes defining and assigning roles and responsibilities for key programmes and departments including EPI

comment.narrative: FMOH has initiated a process of major restructuring to support implementation of the national health priorities of the transitional period. According to the recommendations of WHO high level mission that was organized based on FMOH request, two states will be selected to implement a comprehensive model (phase-based/demonstration projects) to reform the health system and implement the accountability framework

The workshop discussed and endorsed health partners mapping tool.

title.narrative: World Bank : Financial/General Management

a. Update the planning guidelines and template for state level use and further support FMOH on the implementation of PBB. b. Scale up the use of the planning template to additional states though workshops and capacity building activities. c. Identify bottlenecks to efficient budget execution to deliver overall health and immunization services at national and subnational level.

target.value: TA to improve efficiency and effectiveness in planning, budgeting and execution to improve health service delivery in Sudan. The task will include two activities: a. Review and support the FMOH on implementation of PBB and roll out of the planning template to additional states to ensure value for money and equity, and b. Conduct a study on budget execution practices in the health sector with the objective of identifying PFM bottlenecks and unraveling what can be done across budgetary stakeholders to ensure the efficient use of resources to address health sector priorities.

comment.narrative: Given the current situation the Bank team could not continue with hiring of the consultant for the budget execution work. Task 1 - Review and support the FMOH on implementation of PBB and roll out of the planning template to additional states to ensure value for money and equity- is also delayed. FMOH wanted to change this activity into costing of Health Sector Strategic Plan. This is the mother document which guides Federal and State level and planning and budgeting. It would have been a waste to support the sector on planning and budgeting using the old strategy which is about to change and embark into the implementation of the new strategy. The Bank team plans to support the costing activity which is part of the planning and budgeting for sector.

title.narrative: a. Review implementation of the PBB and use of the planning template to the two states as well as documenting lessons learned. b. Information on budget execution in health and immunization program at national and subnational levels collected.

target.value: TA to improve efficiency and effectiveness in planning, budgeting and execution to improve health service delivery in Sudan. The task will include two activities: a. Review and support the FMOH on implementation of PBB and roll out of the planning template to additional states to ensure value for money and equity, and b. Conduct a study on budget execution practices in the health sector with the objective of identifying PFM bottlenecks and unraveling what can be done across budgetary stakeholders to ensure the efficient use of resources to address health sector priorities.

comment.narrative: Initial work on the implementation of PBB has started with a draft on the lessons learned from other countries compiled and ready for dissemination to stakeholders in Sudan. Follow on work will focus on the deep dive on the PBB work in the states and develop a guideline/ tool for planning and budgeting for the States. The focus will be on building capacity to the States and roll out the use of the Planning guideline. In addition, detailed analysis and if possible a case study will be undertaken to learn budget execution trends, impact on health and immunization activities in particular.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
installation of Solar system for the selcted facilities completed

target.value: TA to maintain the current technical support for implementation of solar electrification of health facilities to allow expansion of immunization services to the areas with zero dose-children, establishing fixed immunization services and increased access to regular and sustainable immunization services with focus on services expansion, extension, monitoring, documentation and staff capacity building.

comment.narrative: Based on equipment arrival, this support was planned to be in December 2021 but now constrained by the current country situation

title.narrative: Report on installation of HSS2 equipment and decomssioning of replaced cold chain equipment

target.value: TA to support Ministry of Health in both state and federal level to oversee, coordinate and document the deployment of cold chain equipment under HSS/CCOP and other funds to extend the immunization services in remote areas, disadvantages communities, areas mapped with no permanent access to immunization services and the areas with no or malfunctioning cold chain equipment.

comment.narrative: One consultant already on board and he will continue this support

title.narrative: World Bank : Health Financing/Sustainability
Roadmap to Improve the technical efficiency of delivery of immunization services

target.value: Support to develop a roadmap to improve the technical efficiency of the delivery of immunization services as an entry point to improve the delivery of primary health care

comment.narrative: The draft estimates for the National Deployment and Vaccination Plan for COVID-19 Vaccines in Sudan are ready, shared with the MOH where by they provided feedback. In general they were in agreement with the estimates and also provided comments for improvement. The estimates were revised to incorporate inputs from MOH. Still waiting for another session to further discuss the estimates and approve. The plan is to use estimated for planning for vaccination and deployment plan as well as use for resource mobilization.

target.value: Support to develop a roadmap to improve the technical efficiency of the delivery of immunization services as an entry point to improve the delivery of primary health care

comment.narrative: The draft estimates for the National Deployment and Vaccination Plan for COVID-19 Vaccines in Sudan are ready, shared with the MOH where by they provided feedback. In general they were in agreement with the estimates and also provided comments for improvement. The estimates were revised to incorporate inputs from MOH. Still waiting for another session to further discuss the estimates and approve. The plan is to use estimated for planning for vaccination and deployment plan as well as use for resource mobilization.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
road mapof revamped CHWs program to improve community engagment in immunization service delivery

target.value: Support the FMoH to scale up the deployment of the CHWs, and improve their quality of work to improve defaulter tracing and reach every child with the routine vaccines

comment.narrative: Consultant will start road map exercise of CHWs by July 2021 .

title.narrative: report on the status of CHWs in Sudan including gaps and opportunities to support immunization program

target.value: Support the FMoH to scale up the deployment of the CHWs, and improve their quality of work to improve defaulter tracing and reach every child with the routine vaccines

comment.narrative: ToR of national consultant developed. Given the scope of work of the CHWs that includes the case management of common childhood illnesses including malaria in addition to their role on demand creation for vaccination, there was a need for the engagement of the disease control department as well as the MCH department at the FMoH. The ToR has been shared for their review and inputs which took longer time than the expected and they finally review and agree with the TOR and Consultant was selected and implementation of activity will start in July 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Financing/Sustainability
Policy options to include immunization and other PHC preventive services in NHIF benifit package developed

target.value: Conduct assessment of NHIF institutional readiness to include immunization

comment.narrative: WHO is supporting National Health Insurance Fund and Federal Ministry of Health in the development of the Essential UHC Benefit Package to advance progress towards attaining Universal Health Coverage in Sudan. As part of the development process, feasibility of including immunization and other MCH services was explored. The draft package included immunization services. Provider Payment Mechanisms (PPM) options have been developed. Under the new separation of payer and provider within Sudan, each SMOH is considered as a single provider of MOH services within each State and each SMOH will have a contract with NHIF for the provision of health care for the eligible population. According to the agreed PPM, NHIF will broadly use four payment mechanisms for providing funding for services under contract with each State that include capitation for the provision of primary care by SMOH across the State based on State catchment population (attached report).

target.value: Conduct assessment of NHIF institutional readiness to include immunization

comment.narrative: WHO is supporting National Health Insurance Fund and Federal Ministry of Health in the development of the Essential UHC Benefit Package to advance progress towards attaining Universal Health Coverage in Sudan. As part of the development process, feasibility of including immunization and other MCH services was explored. The draft package included immunization services. Provider Payment Mechanisms (PPM) options have been developed. Under the new separation of payer and provider within Sudan, each SMOH is considered as a single provider of MOH services within each State and each SMOH will have a contract with NHIF for the provision of health care for the eligible population. According to the agreed PPM, NHIF will broadly use four payment mechanisms for providing funding for services under contract with each State that include capitation for the provision of primary care by SMOH across the State based on State catchment population (attached report).

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
National strategy and guidelines on expanding public-private collaboration in PHC services delivery including immunization developed and endorsed by FMOH and partners

target.value: TA to support development of national strategy and guidelines on expanding public-private collaboration in PHC services delivery including immunization

comment.narrative: Terms of Reference of the TA developed and discussed with FMOH. The process of hiring a national consultant and establishing a Techincal Working Group has started however, it is affected and disrupted by the frequent staff turnover (Global Health Department/FMOH) and the recent political developments

target.value: TA to support development of national strategy and guidelines on expanding public-private collaboration in PHC services delivery including immunization

comment.narrative: This activity was delayed due to staff turnover. Two assessments on private sector engagement were completed: - Private health sector and private sector engagement for Universal Health Coverage in Sudan; - Role of private health care sector in combating NCDs at the Primary health care level in Sudan. A national consultant is being recruited to support FMOH in the development of the private sector engagement framework

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Plan to overcome vaccine demand-related barriers in areas with zero-dose children and high risk communities developed

target.value: TA to assess the barriers for delivering EPI key messages by vaccinators to caregivers/parents and to strengthen the capacity of health promotion at national and state level to use data for action with focus on creating demand for immunization in areas with zero-dose children.

comment.narrative: -One consultant already on board and he will continue the support -The consultant will conduct the workshop after assessment is complete.

title.narrative: tools and guidlines for monitoring and reporting developed, behavioural analysis tools and guidlines developed.

target.value: TA to support Health Promotion Directorate at Federal and states level in M&E and implementation of C4D component, conduction of behavioural analysis and to strengthen the system for measurement and monitoring of behavior change including update/ development and design of monitoring and reporting tools and instruments.

comment.narrative: Consultant recruited, working on the monitoring tools and they will be tested by July 30th.

title.narrative: training final report submitted

target.value: TA to train health promotion staff at federal and state level (TOT), to lead the communication for behavior and social change component for immunization with focus on planning, monitoring and evaluation of C4D programing, communication skills, community engagement and addressing rumors and misconceptions.

comment.narrative: Once training completed report will be shared.

target.value: Develop strategies to increase immunization program visibility and increase access to information through mass media and penetration of social networks, to boost public demand for immunization, increase awareness and public trust, map the zero-dose children and design communication strategies to create immunization demand among them
